title: rust:1.60.0-buster docker container is unable to build prost-types
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->
I'm trying to build a docker image for a grpc server I'm working on. Everything works when I build the release binary locally but using the latest docker image fails. Here is a snippet of my Dockerfile.

I tried this code:

```docker
FROM rust:1.60.0-buster@sha256:1de9225709d9b3783261568682aa83ec1922e3ad7c43de40c83b0e5cd82e5d2f as builder
RUN ( rustup  target add x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu && \
    rustup component add rustfmt )
...
RUN cargo build --bin grpc-server --release
```

I expected to see this happen: *Building the binary locally works but not in the docker container*

Instead, this happened: *The compilation fails with the following error:*

```bash

```

### Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rust-stable 1.60-0
```

After doing some related searches, I think the image is missing:

```bash
apt install libprotobuf-dev protobuf-compiler
```

This is referenced [here](https://github.com/tari-project/tari/issues/1781) and [here](https://github.com/tari-project/tari/issues/1790).
